GlooKit.GlooAPI

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • GlooKit.GlooAPI.Texture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Texture>

    public class Texture
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Texture>
    Texture work in tandem with TextureAtlases and can mostly be thought of as a ByteBuffer of pixels Textures also know their width, height, and also possess a couple properties granted to them by their TextureAtlas This includes the coordinates of the upper left and lower right corners of this Texture in the TextureAtlas, as well as the handle of the Texture in the TextureAtlas
    See Also:
    Textures can be added with a String to the filepath of the .png file they come from Textures can only come from .png files Author: Eli Jergensen and Duncan Walter Documenter: Eli Jergensen

    • Constructor Detail

      • Texture

        public Texture(GlooApplication app,
               int textureHandle,
               java.lang.String filepath)
        Constructs a Texture by loading a .png file from a filepath
        Parameters:
        app - the GlooApplication of the TextureAtlas of this Texture
        textureHandle - the handle of this Texture in the TextureAtlas
        filepath - a String of the filepath of the .png file to be loaded

      • Texture

        public Texture(GlooApplication app,
               int textureHandle,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
               int width,
               int height)
        Constructs a Texture by accepting a ByteBuffer, width, and height This is used primarily by GlooFontFamilies to load in GlooCharacters
        Parameters:
        app - The GlooApplication of the TextureAtlas of this Texture
        textureHandle - the handle of this Texture in the TextureAtlas
        buffer - a ByteBuffer of the pixels of this Texture
        width - an int of the number of pixels in a row of the Texture
        height - an int of the number of pixels in a column of the Texture
        See Also:
        GlooFontFamily, GlooCharacter

      • Texture

        protected Texture(GlooApplication app,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Constructs a Texture of width and height that is a purely white, full opacity image This is the Default Texture of the GlooCore The handle of this Texture is GlooCore.DEFAULT
        Parameters:
        app - The GlooApplication of the TextureAtlas of this Texture
        width - an int of the number of pixels in a row of the Texture
        height - an int of the number of pixels in a column of the Texture
        See Also:
        A new TextureAtlas is initialized with only this texture in it

    • Method Detail

      • loadPNGTexture

        private void loadPNGTexture(java.lang.String filename)
        Load in a ByteBuffer from a filepath using the PNGDecoder library
        Parameters:
        filename - a String of the filepath of the .png file to be loaded

      • useOffset

        final void useOffset(Vector offset)
        Notifies this Texture of the offset that it has in the TextureAtlas (This is essentially the upper left corner of the Texture in the TextureAtlas) This is called by the TextureAtlas while texture packing
        See Also:
        TextureAtlas.packTextures()

      • useSize

        final void useSize(Vector size)
        Notifies this Texture of the pointSize of the final TextureAtlas This is called by the TextureAtlas after finishing texture packing
        See Also:
        The Texture then figures out its upper left and lower right corners as well as the width of the TextureAtlas

      • useAtlas

        final void useAtlas()
        This is a dedicated call that only gets called for the 'atlas' Texture of the TextureAtlas, which has coordinates of the upper left and lower right corners of the TextureAtlas itself

        protected java.nio.ByteBuffer getBuffer()

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Texture other)
        This comparator is used by the TextureAtlas to sort Textures first by height and then by width This comparator returns values that are backwards from what you think
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Texture>
        Returns:
        +1 if this Texture is "less than" other, 0 if this Texture is "equal to" other, -1 if this Texture is "greater than" other
